segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 3
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 3

segments.pli: 13. Kusināravagga
segments.en: 13. Kusināra

segments.pli: 127. Hatthakasutta
segments.en: 127. With Hatthaka

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.

segments.pli: Atha kho hatthako devaputto abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇo kevalakappaṃ jetavanaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā:
segments.en: Then, late at night, the glorious god Hatthaka, lighting up the entire Jeta’s Grove, went up to the Buddha. Thinking,

segments.pli: “bhagavato purato ṭhassāmī”ti osīdatimeva saṃsīdatimeva, na sakkoti saṇṭhātuṃ.
segments.en: “I will stand before the Buddha,” he sank and melted down, and wasn’t able to stay still.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi nāma sappi vā telaṃ vā vālukāya āsittaṃ osīdatimeva saṃsīdatimeva, na saṇṭhāti;
segments.en: It’s like when ghee or oil is poured on sand, it sinks and melts down, and can’t remain stable.

segments.pli: evamevaṃ hatthako devaputto:
“bhagavato purato ṭhassāmī”ti osīdatimeva saṃsīdatimeva, na sakkoti saṇṭhātuṃ.
Atha kho bhagavā hatthakaṃ devaputtaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then the Buddha said to Hatthaka,

segments.pli: “oḷārikaṃ, hatthaka, attabhāvaṃ abhinimmināhī”ti.
segments.en: “Hatthaka, manifest in a solid life-form.”

segments.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti, kho hatthako devaputto bhagavato paṭissutvā oḷārikaṃ attabhāvaṃ abhinimminitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi.
segments.en: “Yes, sir,” replied Hatthaka. He manifested in a solid life-form, bowed to the Buddha, and stood to one side.

segments.pli: Ekamantaṃ ṭhitaṃ kho hatthakaṃ devaputtaṃ bhagavā etadavoca:
segments.en: The Buddha said to him,

segments.pli: “Ye te, hatthaka, dhammā pubbe manussabhūtassa pavattino ahesuṃ, api nu te te dhammā etarahi pavattino”ti?
segments.en: “Hatthaka, I wonder whether you still rehearse now the teachings that you rehearsed when you were a human being?”

segments.pli: “Ye ca me, bhante, dhammā pubbe manussabhūtassa pavattino ahesuṃ, te ca me dhammā etarahi pavattino;
segments.en: “I still rehearse now the teachings that I rehearsed as a human being.

segments.pli: ye ca me, bhante, dhammā pubbe manussabhūtassa nappavattino ahesuṃ, te ca me dhammā etarahi pavattino.
segments.en: And I also rehearse teachings that I didn’t rehearse as a human being.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhante, bhagavā etarahi ākiṇṇo viharati bhikkhūhi bhikkhunīhi upāsakehi upāsikāhi rājūhi rājamahāmattehi titthiyehi titthiyasāvakehi;
segments.en: Just as the Buddha these days lives crowded by monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen; by rulers and their ministers, and teachers of other paths and their disciples,

segments.pli: evamevaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, ākiṇṇo viharāmi devaputtehi.
segments.en: so I live crowded by the gods.

segments.pli: Dūratopi, bhante, devaputtā āgacchanti hatthakassa devaputtassa santike ‘dhammaṃ sossāmā’ti.
segments.en: The gods come from far away, thinking, ‘We’ll hear the teaching in the presence of Hatthaka.’

segments.pli: Tiṇṇāhaṃ, bhante, dhammānaṃ atitto appaṭivāno kālaṅkato.
segments.en: Sir, I passed away without getting enough of three things.

segments.pli: Katamesaṃ tiṇṇaṃ?
segments.en: What three?

segments.pli: Bhagavato ahaṃ, bhante, dassanassa atitto appaṭivāno kālaṅkato;
segments.en: Seeing the Buddha;

segments.pli: saddhammasavanassāhaṃ, bhante, atitto appaṭivāno kālaṅkato;
segments.en: hearing the true teaching;

segments.pli: saṅghassāhaṃ, bhante, upaṭṭhānassa atitto appaṭivāno kālaṅkato.
segments.en: and serving the Saṅgha.

segments.pli: Imesaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, tiṇṇaṃ dhammānaṃ atitto appaṭivāno kālaṅkatoti.
segments.en: I passed away without getting enough of these three things.

segments.pli: Nāhaṃ bhagavato dassanassa,
segments.en: I could never get enough

segments.pli: Tittimajjhagā kudācanaṃ;
segments.en: of seeing the Buddha,

segments.pli: Saṃghassa upaṭṭhānassa,
segments.en: serving the Saṅgha,

segments.pli: Saddhammasavanassa ca.
segments.en: or hearing the teaching.

segments.pli: Adhisīlaṃ sikkhamāno,
segments.en: Training in the higher ethics,

segments.pli: saddhammasavane rato;
segments.en: loving to hear the true teaching,

segments.pli: Tiṇṇaṃ dhammānaṃ atitto,
segments.en: Hatthaka has gone to the Aviha realm

segments.pli: hatthako avihaṃ gato”ti.
segments.en: without getting enough of these three things.”

segments.pli: Pañcamaṃ.

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī…

suttaplex.blurb: A god from the Pure Abodes visits the Buddha, and complains about how busy he is.
